meanings.definition: A small tack with a broad, flat head that is used to fasten papers to a bulletin board or wall.
meanings.sent1: I used thumbtacks to pin up my drawing on the bulletin board.
meanings.sent2: The teacher asked us to bring thumbtacks for the class project.
meanings.sent3: When the thumbtacks started talking, the papers on the wall were surprised.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas were like thumbtacks, holding the attention of the audience.
meanings.sent5: The shiny thumbtacks gleamed under the classroom lights.

meanings.definition: To fasten or attach something using thumbtacks.
meanings.sent1: She carefully thumbtacks the poster to the wall to avoid wrinkles.
meanings.sent2: Remember to thumbtacks the corners of the fabric securely.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to thumbtacks its toy mouse to the carpet.
meanings.sent4: His words thumbtacks our attention to the importance of the issue.
meanings.sent5: The chef thumbtacks the recipe card to the kitchen cabinet for easy reference.
